<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Notes">Notes</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=South_America&amp;action=edit&amp;section=36" title="Edit section: Notes">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1011085734">.mw-parser-output .reflist{font-size:90%;margin-bottom:0.5em;list-style-type:decimal}.mw-parser-output .reflist .references{font-size:100%;margin-bottom:0;list-style-type:inherit}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-2{column-width:30em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-3{column-width:25em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns{margin-top:0.3em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns ol{margin-top:0}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns li{page-break-inside:avoid;break-inside:avoid-column}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-alpha{list-style-type:upper-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-roman{list-style-type:upper-roman}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-alpha{list-style-type:lower-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-greek{list-style-type:lower-greek}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-roman{list-style-type:lower-roman}</style><div class="reflist">
<div class="mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-7"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-7">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Sometimes included. Depending on the definition of North America-South America boundary, <a href="/wiki/Panama" title="Panama">Panama</a> could be classified as a <a href="/wiki/List_of_transcontinental_countries" title="List of transcontinental countries">transcontinental country</a>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-OI_1-8"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-OI_1_8-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-OI_1_8-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-OI_1_8-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-OI_1_8-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Occasionally included. Physiographically <a href="#Outlying_islands">a part</a> of South America, but geopolitically <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_geoscheme_for_the_Americas#Caribbean" title="United Nations geoscheme for the Americas">a part</a> of North America.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-9"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-9">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Occasionally included. An isolated volcanic island near the boundary between the <a href="/wiki/African_Plate" title="African Plate">African Plate</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Antarctic_Plate" title="Antarctic Plate">Antarctic Plate</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bouvet_Island" title="Bouvet Island">Bouvet Island</a> is <a href="/wiki/Antarctic_realm" title="Antarctic realm">biogeographically</a> and geologically <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_Antarctic_and_Subantarctic_islands#List_of_Antarctic_islands_north_of_60°_S" title="List of Antarctic and Subantarctic islands">associated</a> with <a href="/wiki/Antarctica" title="Antarctica">Antarctica</a>. Despite being closer to Antarctica and <a href="/wiki/Africa" title="Africa">Africa</a> geographically, the <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_geoscheme_for_the_Americas#South_America" title="United Nations geoscheme for the Americas">United Nations geoscheme</a> has included Bouvet Island in South America instead.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-10"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-10">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Geologically, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/South_Georgia_(island)" title="South Georgia (island)">South Georgia Island</a> and the southernmost portion of mainland South America are both on the <a href="/wiki/Scotia_Plate" title="Scotia Plate">Scotia Plate</a> while the <a href="/wiki/South_Georgia_and_the_South_Sandwich_Islands#South_Sandwich_Islands" title="South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands">South Sandwich Islands</a> is on the nearby <a href="/wiki/South_Sandwich_Plate" title="South Sandwich Plate">Sandwich Plate</a>. <a href="/wiki/Antarctic_realm" title="Antarctic realm">Biogeographically</a> and <a href="/wiki/Antarctic_Convergence" title="Antarctic Convergence">hydrologically</a>, <a href="/wiki/South_Georgia_and_the_South_Sandwich_Islands" title="South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands">South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands</a> is <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_Antarctic_and_Subantarctic_islands#List_of_Antarctic_islands_north_of_60°_S" title="List of Antarctic and Subantarctic islands">associated</a> with <a href="/wiki/Antarctica" title="Antarctica">Antarctica</a>. The <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_geoscheme_for_the_Americas#South_America" title="United Nations geoscheme for the Americas">United Nations geoscheme</a> has included the <a href="/wiki/List_of_territorial_disputes" title="List of territorial disputes">disputed territory</a> in South America.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-11"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-11">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Occasionally included. An isolated volcanic island on the <a href="/wiki/South_American_Plate" title="South American Plate">South American Plate</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ascension_Island" title="Ascension Island">Ascension Island</a> is geologically <a href="#Outlying_islands">a part</a> of South America, but geopolitically <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_geoscheme_for_Africa#Western_Africa" title="United Nations geoscheme for Africa">a part</a> of Africa.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-12"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-12">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Except <a href="/wiki/Bouvet_Island" title="Bouvet Island">Bouvet Island</a>, which has occasionally been included as a part of South America.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-13"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-13">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Both administered as <a href="/wiki/British_Overseas_Territories" title="British Overseas Territories">British Overseas Territories</a> under <a href="/wiki/The_Crown" title="The Crown">The Crown</a>, claimed by Argentina.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-14"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-14">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">An <a href="/wiki/Overseas_departments_and_regions_of_France" title="Overseas departments and regions of France">overseas department and region</a> of <a href="/wiki/French_Fifth_Republic" title="French Fifth Republic">France</a>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-68"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-68">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/La_Paz" title="La Paz">La Paz</a> is the administrative capital of <a href="/wiki/Bolivia" title="Bolivia">Bolivia</a>; <a href="/wiki/Sucre" title="Sucre">Sucre</a> is the constitutional and judicial capital of Bolivia.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-70"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-70">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Bouvet_Island" title="Bouvet Island">Bouvet Island</a> is commonly associated with <a href="/wiki/Antarctica" title="Antarctica">Antarctica</a> (due to proximity), but the <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_geoscheme_for_the_Americas#South_America" title="United Nations geoscheme for the Americas">United Nations geoscheme</a> has included the territory in South America instead.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-69"><a href="#cite_note-69">[60]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-71"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-71">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Includes <a href="/wiki/Easter_Island" title="Easter Island">Easter Island</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Pacific_Ocean" title="Pacific Ocean">Pacific Ocean</a>, a <a href="/wiki/Chile" title="Chile">Chilean</a> territory frequently reckoned in <a href="/wiki/Oceania" title="Oceania">Oceania</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Santiago,_Chile" title="Santiago, Chile">Santiago</a> is the administrative capital of Chile; <a href="/wiki/Valpara%C3%ADso" title="Valparaíso">Valparaíso</a> is the site of legislative meetings.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-72"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-72">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/South_Georgia_and_the_South_Sandwich_Islands" title="South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands">South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Atlantic_Ocean" title="Atlantic Ocean">South Atlantic Ocean</a> has no permanent population, only hosting a periodic contingent of about 100 researchers and visitors.</span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>
<ul><li><span id="cnote_Continent_model"><b><a href="#ref_Continent_model">^</a></b></span> <b>Continent model:</b> In some parts of the world, for example, <a href="/wiki/Latin_America" title="Latin America">Latin America</a>, <a href="/wiki/Languages_of_Europe#Romance" title="Languages of Europe">Latin Europe</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Iran" title="Iran">Iran</a>, South America is viewed as a <a href="/wiki/Continent#Subcontinents" title="Continent">subcontinent</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Americas" title="Americas">Americas</a> (a single continent named America).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Brasil_Emb-Mercosul_240-0"><a href="#cite_note-Brasil_Emb-Mercosul-240">[228]</a></sup> In most of the countries with English as an official language, however, it is considered a <a href="/wiki/Continent" title="Continent">continent</a>; see <a href="/wiki/Americas_(terminology)" title="Americas (terminology)">Americas (terminology)</a>.<br/></li></ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=South_America&amp;action=edit&amp;section=37" title="Edit section: References">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Citations">Citations</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=South_America&amp;action=edit&amp;section=38" title="Edit section: Citations">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011085734" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="reflist">
<div class="mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-UN_WPP-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-UN_WPP_1-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-UN_WPP_1-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-UN_WPP_1-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1067248974">.mw-parser-output cite.citation{font-style:inherit;word-wrap:break-word}.mw-parser-output .citation q{quotes:"\"""\"""'""'"}.mw-parser-output .citation:target{background-color:rgba(0,127,255,0.133)}.mw-parser-output <li id="cite_note-29"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-29">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://unstats.un.org/unsd/methods/m49/m49regin.htm#americas" rel="nofollow">"United Nations Statistics Division – Standard Country and Area Codes Classifications (M49)"</a>. <li id="cite_note-protectedareas-30"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-protectedareas_30-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-protectedareas_30-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://wedocs.unep.org/bitstream/handle/20.500.11822/30152/RevOceania.pdf?sequence=1&amp;isAllowed=y" rel="nofollow"><i>Review of the Protected Areas System in Oceania</i></a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources. 1986. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220120062626/https://wedocs.unep.org/bitstream/handle/20.500.11822/30152/RevOceania.pdf?sequence=1&amp;isAllowed=y" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 20 January 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">17 January</span> 2022</span>. <q>Easter Island on the east has been included on the basis of its Polynesian and biogeographic affinities even though it is politically apart. The other islands of the eastern Pacific (Galapagos, Juan Fernandez, etc.) have sometimes been included in Oceania.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Review+of+the+Protected+Areas+System+in+Oceania&amp;rft.pub=International+Union+for+Conservation+of+Nature+and+Natural+Resources&amp;rft.date=1986&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwedocs.unep.org%2Fbitstream%2Fhandle%2F20.500.11822%2F30152%2FRevOceania.pdf%3Fsequence%3D1%26isAllowed%3Dy&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ASouth+America"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-31"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-31">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFHull1937">Hull, Frank M. (1937). <a class="external text" href="http://hbs.bishopmuseum.org/pubs-online/pdf/op13-10.pdf" rel="nofollow"><i>A Check List of the Syrphidae of Oceania</i></a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. Department of Biology, University of Missouri. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220126074835/http://hbs.bishopmuseum.org/pubs-online/pdf/op13-10.pdf" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 26 January 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">17 January</span> 2022</span>. <q>Oceania is primarily considered as the restricted region treated in this paper, but for comparative purposes, in the table only, it is also considered in a broad sense as including New Guinea, Australia, New Caledonia, New Zealand, the Antipodes, and Galapagos.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=A+Check+List+of+the+Syrphidae+of+Oceania&amp;rft.pub=Department+of+Biology%2C+University+of+Missouri&amp;rft.date=1937&amp;rft.aulast=Hull&amp;rft.aufirst=Frank+M.&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fhbs.bishopmuseum.org%2Fpubs-online%2Fpdf%2Fop13-10.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ASouth+America"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-32"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-32">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://helictite.caves.org.au/pdf4/25.01.Issue.Print.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Oceania Bibliography"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>Helictite: Journal of Australasian Cave Research</i>. <b>25</b> (1). 1987. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220322012745/https://helictite.caves.org.au/pdf4/25.01.Issue.Print.pdf" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 22 March 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. </li>
<li id="cite_note-44"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-44">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20150313000755/http://veja.abril.com.br/blog/ricardo-setti/tema-livre/vergonha-ainda-maior-novas-informacoes-disponiveis-em-um-enorme-banco-de-dados-mostram-que-a-escravidao-no-brasil-foi-muito-pior-do-que-se-sabia-antes/" rel="nofollow">"Vergonha Ainda Maior: Novas informações disponíveis em um enorme banco de dados mostram que a escravidão no Brasil foi muito pior do que se sabia antes ("</a>. <i>Veja</i> (in Portuguese). <li id="cite_note-45"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-45">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Stephen_D._Behrendt" title="Stephen D. Behrendt">Stephen D. <li id="cite_note-58"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-58">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFSmyers1990">Smyers, Richard P. <li id="cite_note-latbar-81"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-latbar_81-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20150510104033/http://www.latinobarometro.org/latNewsShow.jsp" rel="nofollow">"Las religiones en tiempos del Papa Francisco"</a> (in Spanish). Latinobarómetro. April 2014. p. 7. <li id="cite_note-schwartzman-95"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-schwartzman_95-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source" id="CITEREFSchwartzman2008">Schwartzman, Simon (27 January 2008). <a class="external text" href="http://www.schwartzman.org.br/simon/coesion_etnia.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Étnia, condiciones de vida y discriminación"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> (in Spanish). <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20180911195451/http://www.schwartzman.org.br/simon/coesion_etnia.pdf" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 11 September 2018<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-111"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-111">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a class="external text" href="http://www.iedom.fr/IMG/pdf/ra2009_guyane-.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Guyane"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> (in French). <li id="cite_note-merco-219"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-merco_219-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070219171559/http://www.mercopress.com/Detalle.asp?NUM=9036" rel="nofollow">"Brazil plans to build seven nuclear reactors"</a>. <li id="cite_note-236"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-236">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://earthobservatory.nasa.gov/IOTD/view.php?id=88271" rel="nofollow">"A Gap in the Andes : Image of the Day"</a>. <i>Earthobservatory.nasa.gov</i>. 2 April 2015. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20170202012127/http://earthobservatory.nasa.gov/IOTD/view.php?id=88271" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 2 February 2017<span class="reference-accessdate">. <style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1054258005">.mw-parser-output .refbegin{font-size:90%;margin-bottom:0.5em}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents>ul{margin-left:0}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents>ul>li{margin-left:0;padding-left:3.2em;text-indent:-3.2em}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents ul,.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents ul li{list-style:none}@media(max-width:720px){.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents>ul>li{padding-left:1.6em;text-indent:-1.6em}}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-columns{margin-top:0.3em}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-columns ul{margin-top:0}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-columns li{page-break-inside:avoid;break-inside:avoid-column}</style><div class="refbegin" style="">
<ul><li>"South America". <i><a class="external text" href="http://www.columbiagazetteer.org/" rel="nofollow">The Columbia Gazetteer of the World Online</a> <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20060901152611/http://www.columbiagazetteer.org/" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> 1 September 2006 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a></i>. 2005. Cambridge Studies in International Relations.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+State%2C+War+and+the+State+of+War&amp;rft.series=Cambridge+Studies+in+International+Relations&amp;rft.date=1996&amp;rft.aulast=Holsti&amp;rft.aufirst=Kalevi+J.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ASouth+America"></span></li></ul>

<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1097025294">.mw-parser-output .side-box{margin:4px 0;box-sizing:border-box;border:1px solid #aaa;font-size:88%;line-height:1.25em;background-color:#f9f9f9}.mw-parser-output .side-box-abovebelow,.mw-parser-output .side-box-text{padding:0.25em 0.9em}.mw-parser-output .side-box-image{padding:2px 0 2px 0.9em;text-align:center}.mw-parser-output .side-box-imageright{padding:2px 0.9em 2px 0;text-align:center}@media(min-width:500px){.mw-parser-output .side-box-flex{display:flex;align-items:center}.mw-parser-output .side-box-text{flex:1}}@media(min-width:720px){.mw-parser-output .side-box{width:238px}.mw-parser-output .side-box-right{clear:right;float:right;margin-left:1em}.mw-parser-output .side-box-left{margin-right:1em}}</style><div class="side-box side-box-right plainlinks sistersitebox">
